translation: That tathāgata receives an offering of clothing, a meal, a bed, and medicine for illness and thinness.

translation: The great prince, esteemed by the Ajātaśatru, offered five hundred cauldrons of rice every day and prepared a chariot drawn in five hundred carriages to go from Licchavi to Sadāparvata.

translation: The first manifestation of the tamer was about to follow a hundred, gradually two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, and five hundred, using the king's eye to disturb it.

source_sentence: 坐食時，調達欲壞亂比丘僧，誘[言*木]諸比丘，與衣鉢戶鑰鍼筒革屣大小鍵[金*咨](淺鐵鉢也)及餘什物。
translation: When he sat and ate, the Tathāgata wanted to disrupt the monks and nuns, enticed [speaking*mu] the monks, gave them their robes, bowls, door keys, pins, sockets, leather slippers, large and small locks [gold*kāya] (also called shallow iron bowl) and other necessities.

source_sentence: 語諸比丘：「此亦釋種瞿曇、我亦釋種瞿曇。
translation: He said to the monks, This is also Śākyamuni Gautama and I am also Śākyamuni Gautama.

source_sentence: 此亦母族成就、我亦母族成就。
translation: This is also the accomplishment of my mother's clan, and I am also the accomplishment of my mother's clan.

source_sentence: 此亦生釋家、我亦生釋家。
translation: This also gives rise to the family of the Śākyas, and I too will give rise to the family of the Śākyas.

source_sentence: 此族姓與我無殊。」
translation: This family is no different from mine.

source_sentence: 爾時國界飢饉乞求難得，時眾多比丘著衣持鉢入羅閱祇城乞食。
translation: It was then that the border of the country became hungry and difficult to beg for food, and many monks put on their robes and bowls and went into Rājagṛha to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 乞食已，聞調達欲壞亂比丘僧，誘[言*木]諸比丘，與衣鉢戶鑰鍼筒革屣大鍵[金*咨]小鍵[金*咨]。
translation: After he had begged for food, he heard that Tathāgata wanted to disrupt the monks and nuns, enticed [saying *mu] the monks, gave them their robes, bowls, door keys, pins, sockets, shoes, leather sandals, large locks [gold*abiding], and small locks [gold*abiding].

source_sentence: 及什物，諸調達弟子貪衣共相佐助。
translation: He and his belongings, the disciples of the tamer craved their robes and assisted each other.

source_sentence: 眾多比丘乞食已，出羅閱城至世尊所，頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: After the many monks had begged for food, they left Rājagṛha and went to the Bhagavān, bowed their heads and feet, and sat to one side.

translation: This deluded person suffers pain for a long time and has no limit to it.

translation: I also know that the Tathāgata will destroy the monks and saṃgha, correctly so, and that when he eats, he'll destroy the harmonious saṃgha.

source_sentence: 時天地闇冥，天人失明。
translation: At that time heaven and earth were in darkness, and the gods and humans lost their light.

source_sentence: 如來法向暮必還和合僧，若不和合者，天地翻覆。」
translation: The Tathāgata's teaching will surely return to reconcile the saṃgha before sunset, and if it doesn't reconcile, heaven and earth will overthrow it.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗、目揵連聞調達破壞和合僧，聞已往詣世尊，頭面禮足在一面坐，白世尊言：「調達以破壞和合僧。
translation: When Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana heard that the Tathāgata disrupted the harmony of the saṃgha, they went to the Bhagavān after hearing it, bowed their heads and feet at one side, and said to the Bhagavān, The Tathāgata disrupts the harmony of the saṃgha by disrupting the harmony.

source_sentence: 今欲往詣調達所，還和合僧。」
translation: Now, I want to go to the tathāgata's place and return to harmonize with the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 世尊告舍利弗、目揵連曰：「速往。
translation: The Bhagavān told Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, Go quickly.

source_sentence: 今正是時。」
translation: Now is the right time.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗、目揵連即從座起，頭面禮足，繞佛三匝而往詣調達所。
translation: Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana then rose from their seats, bowed their heads and feet, circumambulated the Buddha three times, and went to Dada.

source_sentence: 遙見調達如如來昇高座說法，諸比丘僧圍遶，右有騫陀、陀婆，左有迦留羅、提施(四人是調達左右弟子)，海義捉拂在後。
translation: From a distance, he saw the Tathāgata as the Tathāgata ascending to a high seat and preaching the Dharma, surrounded by the monks and nuns, with Gandhāra and Deva on his right and Kālôdayin and Tiṣya on his left (four of whom were the Tathāgata's left and right disciples), followed by Hayagrīva holding a whisk behind him.

source_sentence: 調達遙見舍利弗目揵連來，歡喜踊躍不能自勝：「是沙門瞿曇上足弟子，今來至我所。」
translation: From a distance, Tathāgata saw Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana coming, rejoicing and jumping joyfully but unable to overcome himself, This is the ascetic Gautama's superior-legged disciple who's coming to me now.

source_sentence: 如世尊見舍利弗、目連等法，唱言：「善來比丘。」
translation: Suppose the Bhagavān sees the teachings of Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana and calls them, Well-come monks.

source_sentence: 調達亦復唱言：「善來舍利弗、目揵連。」
translation: Again, Tathāgata also called out, Well come, Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 起右騫陀，坐舍利弗；
translation: He rose from his seat on the right side and sat at the feet of Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 起左迦留陀，坐目揵連。
translation: He rose to his left Kālôdayin and sat there, facing Maudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 如世尊告：「尊者舍利弗、目揵連與諸比丘說法。
translation: As the Bhagavān told them, Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana taught the Dharma to the monks.

source_sentence: 我今患脊疼欲得小息。」
translation: Now, I'm suffering from back pain and want to attain a little peace.

source_sentence: 調達亦復告舍利弗、目揵連：「與諸比丘說法。
translation: Again, Dharmodgata told Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, Teach the Dharma to the monks.

source_sentence: 我今患脊痛欲小息。」
translation: Now, I'm suffering from back pain and want to take a short rest.

source_sentence: 如世尊四褻襞優多僧布床上，僧伽梨著頭前，右脇倚臥師子座，互屈伸脚，繫意念明何時當曉。
translation: Suppose the Bhagavān spreads his four robes on a monk's bed, puts his saṃghāraṇī in front of his head, lies down on his right side with his lion seat, bends and extends his legs one after the other, and ties his thoughts together to remember when it will dawn.

source_sentence: 調達亦復爾。
translation: So it is with the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 時調達眠，首陀會天來下，壓其身。
translation: When Tathāgata was asleep, the god Śuddhāvāsa came down and crushed his body.

source_sentence: 甚欲得覺，竭力不能得覺，喘息麁惡，或時寱語手脚不住，捫摸四壁作種種變，不能得覺。
translation: They want to get an ideation, but they can't get an ideation with all their strength; sometimes they pant and pant in anger, speak words that don't abide, touch the four walls or make various transformations, but they can't get an ideation.

source_sentence: 時尊者舍利弗歎譽佛法及比丘僧。
translation: Venerable Śāriputra then praised the Buddha's teaching and the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 時目揵連作若干變化，東沒西出南沒北出，坐臥虛空。
translation: Maudgalyāyana then made several transformations, going east, west, south, and north, sitting and lying in the sky.

source_sentence: 或坐三昧，於三昧中放種種光明，或青或黃、或赤或黑、或琉璃色。
translation: Sometimes he sits in concentration and radiates various kinds of light, whether blue, yellow, red, black, or lapis lazuli-colored.

source_sentence: 身下出火身上出水，身上出火身下出水。
translation: Under the body, fire emerges from the body, and water emerges from the body, and under the body with fire emerging from the body, water emerges from the body.

source_sentence: 西南上下作若干變化無所罣礙，放諸光明普有所照。
translation: To the southwest and up, they perform various transformations without obstruction, emanating light that illuminates everywhere.

source_sentence: 時五百比丘見目揵連現諸變化，各共相語：「我等不墮顛倒見婆？
translation: When the five hundred monks saw Maudgalyāyana manifest various transformations, they each said to each other, We won't fall into mistaken views, Bhāviveka?

source_sentence: 云何捨如來依倚調達？」
translation: How do you abandon the Tathāgata's reliance and discipline?

source_sentence: 復作是念：「此必然不疑。」
translation: Again, he thought, This is certainly not doubtful.

source_sentence: 時尊者舍利弗、目揵連與說法言，便心開意解，起慈心向如來悔前所為。
translation: When Venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana spoke the Dharma to them, their minds were enlightened, and they became compassionate toward the Tathāgata and repented of what they had done before.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗、目揵連及五百比丘來詣世尊所，調達座上盡空無人，唯有調達及四弟子。
translation: When Śāriputra, Maudgalyāyana, and the five hundred monks came to the Bhagavān, there was no one else on the Tathāgata's seat but Tathāgata and his four disciples.

source_sentence: 時騫茶陀婆比丘以左脚蹋調達使覺，捉起調達：「舍利弗、目揵連將五百人去，座席盡空。」
translation: The monk Candrabha then stepped with his left foot onto Dada's messenger and awakened, grabbed him and raised Dada, saying, Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana are leaving with 500 people, and their seats are all empty.

source_sentence: 時調達覺見座上空無復有人，便從座上自投于地。
translation: When Bodhidharma perceived that there was no one else in the sky above his seat, he rose from his seat and threw himself to the ground.

source_sentence: 其弟子以水灑面，還坐床上。
translation: The disciple sprinkled his face with water and returned to his seat on the bed.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊從靜室起，出至外堂，床上布尼師壇結跏趺坐。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān rose from his secluded room, left the outer hall, and sat cross-legged on his couch at the altar of the poṇi master.

source_sentence: 時五百比丘遙見如來於堂上結跏趺坐，內懷慚愧外則恥眾，前行詣如來。
translation: When the five hundred monks saw the Tathāgata from a distance, they sat cross-legged in the hall, internally shameful and externally embarrassed, and went to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 如來亦見五百比丘來，顧語阿難：「若我不與語者，沸血當從面孔出。」
translation: Seeing the five hundred monks coming, the Tathāgata also looked at Ānanda and said to him, If I don't tell them, boiling blood will come out of my face.

source_sentence: 時如來以大悲意欲度彼人，便與共語：「善來比丘！
translation: The Tathāgata then wanted to save that person with great compassion, so he said to them together, Well-come monk!

source_sentence: 如來難遇，時時乃有。
translation: The Tathāgata is difficult to meet, but he does so from time to time.

source_sentence: 雖如來出世，聞法亦難。
translation: Even though the Tathāgata has appeared in the world, it's difficult to hear the teaching.

source_sentence: 欲求滅度亦復難得。
translation: Those who want to seek cessation are also difficult to attain.

translation: When these twelve conditions were explained, five hundred monks attained the path of arhatship, and 80,000 celestial maidens attained purity of the Dharma eye.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，備十功德，為沙門結戒：「若比丘有壞亂和合僧，僧伽婆尸沙。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān prepared ten virtues and established the precepts for the ascetic, If a monk has disrupted the harmonious saṃgha, it's Saṃghâvaśeṣa.

translation: Tuṣita violates this, and there's no help to enter hell.

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊王舍城耆闍崛山金毘羅閱叉所住處，有大石室。
translation: The Buddha, the World-honored One, was staying at Kapilavastu on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa in Rājagṛha. There is a large stone chamber where the Blessed One sojourned.

source_sentence: 爾時調達欲害世尊，以四千兩金雇四力人，共此四人上耆闍崛山，抱大石當石室上立，伺如來出。
translation: Desiring to harm the Bhagavān, he hired four strong men of four thousand taels of gold and went up Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa with these four men, embraced a large rock, stood in a rock chamber, and waited for the Tathāgata to leave.

source_sentence: 時佛出石室將經行，調達共此四人山上下石磓如來。
translation: When the Buddha emerged from the stone chamber and was about to walk, Dada and these four men went up and down the mountain together with the Tathāgata Śrīgarbha Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 時金毘羅閱叉在世尊後，仰視大石來下，兩手接之以擲南山。
translation: At that time the king Kapilavastu was standing behind the World-honored One. Looking up at the great rock, he came down and tossed it with both hands on the southern side of the mountain.

source_sentence: 彼時此石碎散，有小叚縱廣七十步，迸來向世尊。
translation: At the time, this stone was broken apart, and a small piece of it, seventy feet long and seventy feet wide, burst into flames and flew toward the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 時如來為眾生故，現宿對有報，即坐三昧飛昇虛空，石亦逐後，眾生盡見；
translation: At that time the Tathāgata, for the sake of sentient beings, manifested a constellation to show them some reward. He sat in meditation and flew up into the sky. The stone also followed behind him, and all sentient beings saw him.

source_sentence: 南西北方，石皆逐後。
translation: To the south and to the northwest, the stone carriages follow one another.

source_sentence: 時如來入大海水中，石亦逐後。
translation: When the Tathāgata entered the ocean water, the stone also followed him.

source_sentence: 時如來昇須彌頂，石亦隨之。
translation: The Tathāgata then ascended to the top of Mount Sumeru, and so did the stone.

source_sentence: 時如來上四王尼耶山上天宮，石亦隨之。
translation: The Tathāgata then ascended to the celestial palace of the four kings on Mount Nyaya, and so did the stone.

source_sentence: 時如來上三十三天、焰魔、兜率、涅磨羅那提、波羅尼蜜婆舍跋提、梵伽夷、梵、福婁醯陀、波栗多婆、阿婆嘬羅、阿男斃弗如、鉢羞多、毘頗羅宿呵、宿呵阿施那、宿呵訖栗那、阿迦尼吒天，石亦隨後。
translation: The Tathāgata then ascended to the Trāyastriṃśavartin Heaven of the Thirty-three Gods, the Yama gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmita-vaśavartin gods, the Brahma gods, the Brahma gods, the Brahmā gods, the Puṛjideva gods, the Parītavana god

source_sentence: 時世尊以神足力還石室戶。
translation: The Bhagavān then returned to the door of the stone room with his miraculous powers.

source_sentence: 此石磓世尊右足趺，破脚血流。
translation: This is a stone bowl for the Bhagavān's right foot, which breaks through his feet and flows blood.

source_sentence: 此調達及四力士為無救罪。
translation: These tamers and the four strong men are guilty of no-salvation crimes.

source_sentence: 「非空非海中，　　非入山石間，
translation: “It’s not empty, not in the ocean, not between mountains or stones.

source_sentence: 無有地方所，　　得脫宿罪殃。」
translation: There's no place where one can be freed from past sins and misfortune.

source_sentence: 時世尊患脚疼痛，自力說偈曰：時眾多比丘在石室左右，乍坐乍行，恐調達害如來。
translation: When the Bhagavān was suffering from pain in his feet, he spoke a verse on his own authority, saying, Many monks were at the left and right of the stone chamber when they sat and walked, fearing that Daoists would harm the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 時如來遙見，知而問阿難：「彼眾多比丘石室外，何等作為，乍行乍坐？」
translation: Seeing from a distance, the Tathāgata knew and asked Ānanda, What did those many monks do outside the stone when they were walking and sitting?

source_sentence: 阿難白佛：「遙看如來，恐調達害，是故在彼乍行乍坐。」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, Look at the Tathāgata from a distance, for fear that he might harm Daoda; therefore, he's there for the first time walking and for the first time sitting.

source_sentence: 世尊告阿難曰：「如來出世，調達終不能害。
translation: The World-honored One said to Ānanda: When the Tathāgata appears in the world, his tamer will never harm anyone.

source_sentence: 汝頗聞如來為人所害不？」
translation: Have you heard that the Tathāgata is harmed by people?

source_sentence: 「不也。
translation: “No, they won’t.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 時世尊仰視，時四力士見如來視，心懷恐懼衣毛皆竪，欲走脚不移。
translation: When the Bhagavān looked upward, the four strong men saw the Tathāgata's eyes, and their hair stood on end in fear, wanting to walk but they didn't.

source_sentence: 時諸沙門一一捉得，來詣佛所。
translation: The ascetics then grabbed each of them and came to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 時如來語四力士：「善來童子！
translation: The Tathāgata then said to the four strong men, Well-come, boy!

source_sentence: 我與汝說法。」
translation: I'll explain the teaching to you.

source_sentence: 時四力士頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: The four strong men then bowed their heads and feet and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 時世尊與說法語，解悅其意，各使歡喜。
translation: The Bhagavān then explained the teaching to them, pleasing their minds and making them rejoice.

source_sentence: 「童子汝還本舍，勿向向者來處。」
translation: “Boy, return to your original dwelling and don’t go or come to the place where you’re headed.”

source_sentence: 時調達見此四人遲不時到，更以八千兩金雇八大力士：「汝往殺此四人，使根本斷。」
translation: Seeing these four people late and not arriving at the right time, Tathāgata hired eight great men with 8,000 taels of gold to go kill these four people so that they'll be permanently eliminated.

source_sentence: 時世尊遙見八力士來，告曰：「善來童子！
translation: The Bhagavān then saw the eight strong men coming from a distance and told them, Well-come, boy!

source_sentence: 我與汝等說諸法言。」
translation: I'll explain the words of the teachings to you.

source_sentence: 時八力士頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: The eight strong men then bowed their heads and feet and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 時世尊與說法，解悅其意，各使歡喜。
translation: The Bhagavān then explained the teaching to them, pleasing their minds and making them rejoice.

source_sentence: 「童子汝還本舍，勿向向者來處。」
translation: “Boy, return to your original dwelling and don’t go or come to the place where you’re headed.”

source_sentence: 時調達見此八人復遲不至，復以十六千兩金雇十六力士：「汝往殺彼八人，斷其根本。」
translation: Seeing these eight people, the Tathāgata was again late and didn't arrive, and he hired sixteen strong men with 60,000 taels of gold, saying, Go kill those eight people and cut off their roots.

source_sentence: 世尊遙見十六人來，告曰：「善來童子！
translation: The Bhagavān saw sixteen people coming from a distance and told them, Well-come, boy!

source_sentence: 我與汝說法。」
translation: I'll explain the teaching to you.

source_sentence: 時十六人頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: The sixteen people then bowed their heads and feet at one side.

source_sentence: 時世尊與說法，解悅其意，各使歡喜。
translation: The Bhagavān then explained the teaching to them, pleasing their minds and making them rejoice.

source_sentence: 告曰童子：「汝還本舍，勿向向者來處。」
translation: He told the boy, Return to your original dwelling and don't go to someone who's coming or going.

source_sentence: 時調達見十六人復不時至，更雇三十二人：「汝往殺十六人，斷其根本。」
translation: Seeing sixteen people who didn't arrive at the time, he hired thirty-two more people, saying, Go kill sixteen people and cut off their roots.

source_sentence: 世尊遙見三十二人來，世尊告曰：「善來童子！
translation: The Bhagavān saw thirty-two people coming from a distance, and the Bhagavān told them, Well-come, boy!

source_sentence: 我與汝說法。」
translation: I'll explain the teaching to you.

source_sentence: 時三十二人頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: The thirty-two people then bowed their heads and feet at one side and sat down.

source_sentence: 時世尊為說法，解悅其意，各懷歡喜。
translation: The Bhagavān then taught the Dharma for them, pleasing their minds and joyful in their hearts.

source_sentence: 「童子！
translation: Boy!

source_sentence: 汝還本舍，從其所宜。」
translation: Return to your original dwelling and follow what's appropriate.

source_sentence: 時三十二人承世尊命，從座起，頭面禮足而去。
translation: The thirty-two people then, following the Bhagavān's order, rose from their seats, bowed their heads and feet, and departed.

source_sentence: 時世尊見三十二人去不久，顧語阿難：「汝往入羅閱城，往大市四街巷頭，作是唱言：『若調達所作行、身口意所為，莫呼佛法僧教使為，調達自有親信弟子。』」
translation: Seeing the thirty-two people who were soon leaving, the Bhagavān looked at Ānanda and said to him, Go into Rājagṛha, enter the city, go to the four streets of the great marketplace, and make this proclamation, saying, 'If you do what Tathāgata does with body, speech, and thought, don't call them buddhas, Dharma, saṃgha, or envoys

source_sentence: 時阿難白佛：「前歎譽調達，今復說其惡。
translation: Ānanda then said to the Buddha, Formerly I praised Sadāparibhūta but now I'll explain his evil.

source_sentence: 眾人有譏者，當云何答？」
translation: If the people criticize him, how will they answer?

source_sentence: 世尊告阿難曰：「有此語者，以此語答。
translation: The Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, If someone has these words, they'll answer with these words.

source_sentence: 『本雖習善，今復習惡，何足怪耶！』」
translation: 'Although I used to cultivate goodness, now I'll cultivate evil, so why should I wonder?'

source_sentence: 時阿難將一比丘，即詣羅閱城，住大市街巷頭，告諸行人：「調達所作行、身口意所為者，莫呼佛法僧教，調達自有親信弟子。」
translation: Ānanda then took a monk to Rājagṛha, stayed at the entrance of a large marketplace and lane, and told the practitioners, Don't call out to the Buddha, Dharma, or Saṃgha for what he does with body, speech, or mind, because he has faith in his own disciples.

source_sentence: 時阿闍世大子其左右傍臣事親調達者，聞說調達惡名，還相謂言：「沙門瞿曇甚為憎嫉，謗賢調達。
translation: When the Ajātaśatru, the prince of Mahāprajñāpāramitā, and his left and right ministers who were personally tamed, heard the bad name tamer and returned to each other, saying, The ascetic Gautama is so hateful and jealous that he denigrates the good tamer.

source_sentence: 調達豈有身口過耶？」
translation: Is there a mistake in the body and speech of Tathāgata?

source_sentence: 時調達亦聞此聲，「沙門瞿曇遣信入羅閱城，住大市道頭，作是唱言：『若調達信行、身口意所為，莫謂佛法僧教。
translation: The Tathāgata then also heard this sound, saying, “The renunciant Gotama sent a letter to the city of Rājagṛha and stayed at the crossroads of the great marketplace.

source_sentence: 調達自有親信弟子。』」
translation: Tathāgata himself has faith in his disciples.'

source_sentence: 時調達加瞋意熾盛，往詣阿闍世大子所，語作是言：「卿自殺父，我殺沙門瞿曇。
translation: With intense anger, he went to the great prince Ajātaśatru and said, You killed your father, and I killed the ascetic Gautama.

source_sentence: 汝作摩竭大王，我當作佛。
translation: You will become the great king of Magadha, and I will become a buddha.

source_sentence: 於摩竭界裏，新王、新佛不亦快耶。」
translation: In the Magadha realm, aren't the new kings and new buddhas also happy?

source_sentence: 王聞是語歡喜。
translation: The king heard these words and rejoiced.

source_sentence: 時王頻婆娑羅乘羽寶車，詣後園觀。
translation: The king Bimbisāra then rode the feathered jeweled chariot and went to the rear garden to observe.

source_sentence: 時阿闍世大子腰帶利劍，自匿在門間待父王。
translation: The great prince Ajātaśatru, carrying a sharp sword at his waist, hid himself in the doorway and waited for his father.

source_sentence: 王竟日戲駕駟馬車還宮，適入門時，大子以劍遙擲馬，去駚竟不中。
translation: The king returned to the palace in a carriage drawn by oars and horses. When he entered the gate, the prince threw his sword at the horse from a distance so far away that it would not hit him when he came out of the carriage.

source_sentence: 王時大子便走四人逐得四人，問曰：「大子欲何所為？」
translation: The king then asked, What do you want, prince?

source_sentence: 大子答言：「我欲殺王。」
translation: The prince answered, I want to kill the king.

source_sentence: 四人復問：「伴黨是誰？」
translation: The four people again asked, Who's the companion?

source_sentence: 「是賢調達及四弟子。」
translation: These are the four disciples of Bhadra and the four disciples.

source_sentence: 時四人議曰：「若實爾者，當盡取沙門釋子殺。」
translation: The four men then agreed, If that's the case, they'll take all the ascetics and Śākyamunis and kill them.

source_sentence: 或復議曰：「置沙門釋子，但取調達、將從殺。」
translation: Or they might again discuss it, saying, Suppose an ascetic or a son of the Śākyamuni but takes a tamer and is about to kill him.

source_sentence: 復有議曰：「亦莫殺沙門釋子，亦莫殺調達將從。
translation: Again, there was another discussion that said, Don't kill the ascetic or the son of the ascetic, and don't kill the Tathāgata who was about to follow him.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此王頻婆娑羅吉祥良善，繫牢獄應死者常赦宥之，況當殺沙門釋子及調達將從耶？
translation: This king Bimbisara is auspicious and good, and he's imprisoned in a prison that should always be pardoned if he dies, so why wouldn't he kill the ascetics, Śākyamunis, and the followers of the Tathāgata?

source_sentence: 旦往白王，王自當處斷，我等何為於此自作怨咎？」
translation: They went to the king at sunrise and told him, 'The king himself will cut it off, so why should we ourselves create enemies here?'

source_sentence: 即往白王。
translation: He went to the king and told him.

source_sentence: 王於明日出殿上坐，遣信往呼大子阿闍世。
translation: On the following day, the king came out of the palace and took his seat in the hall. He sent a letter to summon the great prince Ajātaśatru.

source_sentence: 大子至，即問：「童子！
translation: When the prince arrived, he asked, Boy!

source_sentence: 子欲何為？」
translation: What do you want?

source_sentence: 「我欲殺王。」
translation: I want to kill the king.

source_sentence: 「汝何以弒吾？」
translation: Why are you killing me?

source_sentence: 大子言：「王有鳴鼓、我無鳴鼓，王有曲蓋、我無曲蓋，王有鹵簿、我無鹵簿。」
translation: The prince said, The king has a sounding drum and I don't have a sounding drum; the king has a crooked canopy and I don't have a crooked canopy; the king has a harp record and I don't have a harp record.

source_sentence: 王告大子：「汝代我處，鳴鼓、曲蓋、鹵簿盡隨汝後。」
translation: The king told the great prince, Take my place and follow me with your drums, bend your canopies, and set aside all of your records.

source_sentence: 時鳴鼓、曲蓋、鹵簿即隨大子後。
translation: He then sounded the drum, twisted the lid, and folded the recorder to follow the prince.

source_sentence: 時大子佞諂傍臣便作是語：「若審爾者，大子就位。
translation: The great prince then flattered the attendant ministers and said, If you judge this, the great prince will take his seat.

source_sentence: 就位已，取父王弒，一以自由。」
translation: After he ascended to the throne, he took his father and kicked him away, one by one.

source_sentence: 時大子可其所白，即遣旃陀羅往收父王閉著獄中，即往收王繫獄。
translation: After approving of what he said, the prince sent Candra to take his father into prison and put him in jail, and then he went to the king's bound prison.

source_sentence: 王素仁慈於民，數千萬人送食餉王。
translation: The king was originally benevolent and compassionate to the people, and tens of thousands of people offered food and rations to the king.

source_sentence: 阿闍世問傍臣：「父王故活耶？」
translation: The Ajātaśatru asked the attendant minister, Is your father alive?

source_sentence: 答言：「故活。」
translation: He replied, That's why I'm alive.

source_sentence: 「何由活？」
translation: How is it possible to live?

source_sentence: 答：「人民送食來餉故活。」
translation: Answer, The people send food to feed their old lives.

source_sentence: 王勅莫使人得前。
translation: The king commanded them not to allow anyone to go before him.

source_sentence: 時諸夫人送食往餉。
translation: The ladies then sent food to feed him.

source_sentence: 阿闍世問：「父王故活耶？」
translation: The Ajātaśatru asked, Is your father alive?

source_sentence: 答言：「活。」
translation: He replied, alive.

source_sentence: 復勅門家莫令夫人得前。
translation: Again, he ordered the doorkeeper not to allow his wife to get in front of him.

source_sentence: 時第一夫人以飲食塗身，外著衣裳不令現，入見王，使王就身上食。
translation: The first wife then rubbed food and drink on her body, put on her robes and clothes outside without making them visible, went in to see the king, and asked him to eat on her body.

source_sentence: 王復問：「父王故活耶？」
translation: The king again asked, Is your father the king alive?

source_sentence: 答言：「活。」
translation: He replied, alive.

source_sentence: 勅莫令夫人入。
translation: I ordered you not to allow the lady to enter.

source_sentence: 所繫獄門向耆闍崛山，遙見世尊與比丘僧舍利弗、目揵連、阿那崙陀、難提、金鞞羅，上山下山。
translation: From a distance, the World-honored One and the monks Saṃsāriputta, Maudgalyāyana, Anuruddha, Nandi, and Kimbila were seen ascending and descenting from the mountain.

source_sentence: 王得道迹，見比丘僧歡喜，無有飢渴想。
translation: The king found the traces of the Way and saw that the monks and nuns were delighted. He had no thoughts of hunger or thirst.

source_sentence: 王阿闍世問傍臣：「父王猶活乎？」
translation: The king Ajātaśatru asked the attendant ministers, Is your father still alive?

source_sentence: 答言：「王活。」
translation: He replied, The king is alive.

source_sentence: 王問傍臣：「以何故活？」
translation: The king asked the attendant minister, Why are you alive?

source_sentence: 傍臣嫉妬答言：「日向如來謁拜，以是故活。」
translation: The attendant ministers were jealous and replied, I'm going to see the Tathāgata on a daily basis to pay my respects; it's because of this that I live.

source_sentence: 王告曰：「汝促往築高牆障獄前，莫令見耆闍崛山。」
translation: The king told him, Urge them to build a high wall in front of the prison and prevent them from seeing Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa.

source_sentence: 即往築令不見。
translation: He then went to build it so that he wouldn't see it.

source_sentence: 諸去來現在佛常法，若欲入城有諸瑞應，象鳴鼻面舉馬亦皆鳴牛吼，鳧雁鴛鴦孔雀鸚鵡、白鵠千秋[雀*鳥]盡皆和鳴，箜篌箏鼓琵琶筑笛不鼓自鳴。
translation: It's always the Buddha's teaching that if he wants to enter the city, there are signs of auspiciousness in response, such as elephants singing with their noses and faces raising horses, geese, wild geese, mandarin ducks, apes, peacocks, parrots, white birds, and thousand autumn [birds*birds] all singing harmoniously together,

source_sentence: 諸長者庫藏金銀水精瑠璃珊瑚虎珀車渠馬瑙，不觸自作聲。
translation: The elders in the storehouse of gold, silver, water spirits, lapis lazuli, coral, tiger- emerald chariots, and horse agate don't touch or make their own sounds.

source_sentence: 盲者得目、聾者能聽、瞎跛躄癭諸苦痛者皆得休息，伏藏自發。
translation: The blind get their eyes, the deaf can hear it, and the blind and crippled who suffer pain will all attain rest, and the hidden will arise on its own.

source_sentence: 世尊入城有此瑞應。
translation: The Bhagavān entered the city, and there was this miraculous response.

source_sentence: 時王頻婆娑羅知佛入城，踊躍歡喜。
translation: Knowing that the Buddha had entered the city, King Bimbisara jumped and rejoiced.

source_sentence: 於獄孔隙瞻視世尊及比丘僧。
translation: In a hole in the hell, he looked at the Bhagavān and the monks.

source_sentence: 王得道迹，見世尊除飢渴想。
translation: The king attained the traces of the Way and saw the World-honored One rid himself of his hunger and thirst.

source_sentence: 時王阿闍世問諸傍臣：「父王猶活耶？」
translation: The king Ajātaśatru then asked the attendants, Is your father still alive?

source_sentence: 答言：「故活。」
translation: He replied, That's why I'm alive.

source_sentence: 問：「以何故活？」
translation: He asked, Why is it alive?

source_sentence: 諸臣嫉妬答王言：「父王於獄孔隙瞻視世尊入城，使其活耳。」
translation: The ministers were jealous and replied to the king, My father, the king, looked at the Bhagavān in the pores of hell and entered the city to keep him alive.

source_sentence: 「卿往以利劍削足下，勿令得行，重加桎梏。」
translation: “You go down to cut off your feet with a sharp sword, don’t allow them to walk, and place them heavily fettered.”

source_sentence: 即往削足，重加桎鎖。
translation: He then went to cut off his legs and added a heavy fetter.

source_sentence: 王日羸瘦。
translation: The king grew weary day by day.

source_sentence: 時阿闍世入宮與夫人共食。
translation: The Ajātaśatru then entered the palace and ate with his wife.

source_sentence: 阿闍世有幼子，在外鬪雞戲。
translation: The Ajātaśatru had a young boy who was outside fighting and playing with the fowl.

source_sentence: 王阿闍世問夫人：「幼子所在？」
translation: The king Ajātaśatru asked the lady, Where's your child?

source_sentence: 答：「在外鬪雞戲。」
translation: He answered, Outside, he fights and plays with chickens.

source_sentence: 王語夫人：「呼來共食。」
translation: The king said to his wife, Come and eat together.

source_sentence: 時幼子即抱雞入而不肯食。
translation: The young boy then embraced the chicken and entered but refused to eat it.

source_sentence: 王問：「何故不食？」
translation: The king asked, Why won't you eat?

source_sentence: 「若此雞不食，我終不食。」
translation: If this chicken doesn't eat, I won't eat after all.

source_sentence: 時阿闍世語夫人言：「奈此幼子何？
translation: The Ajātaśatru then said to his wife, What's wrong with this young boy?

source_sentence: 我今大王欲令共雞食！」
translation: Now, great king, I want to make you eat together with me!

source_sentence: 夫人答言：「王何所嫌？
translation: The queen replied, What's the king's displeasure?

source_sentence: 或有人以兒故食雞肉。」
translation: Perhaps someone eats chicken meat for the sake of their child.

source_sentence: 王聽夫人所白，憶本父王執辛苦不。
translation: When the king heard what the queen told him, he remembered that his father, the king, was suffering from hardship.

source_sentence: 王問夫人：「有何辛苦？」
translation: The king asked the queen, What's so hard?

source_sentence: 夫人答王：「王小時患左手母指，晝夜患痛不得眠寐。
translation: The queen said to the king, “Your majesty, I am suffering from pain all day and night on my left forefinger.

source_sentence: 時父王抱王膝上，取王痛指含著口中，指得暖氣王得小睡。
translation: The father king embraced the king on his knees, took the king's painful finger and put it in his mouth, and he got a little sleep when he got warm energy from that finger.

source_sentence: 時指膿潰於王口裏，王作是念：『若我出指去膿，或能疼痛。』
translation: When the fingers and pus were crushed in the king's mouth, the king thought, 'If I pull out my fingers to remove the pus, it might hurt.'

source_sentence: 即便咽膿而不出指。
translation: He then swallowed the pus and didn't give up his fingers.

source_sentence: 汝父有是辛苦，不揚於外。
translation: Your father has suffered this kind of hardship, so you won't tell him outside.

source_sentence: 願王見原，莫殺王。」
translation: May the king see the plain and not kill the king.

source_sentence: 王聞是語，默然不言。
translation: Having heard these words, the king remained silent.

source_sentence: 時夫人謂呼以原，即出堂戶唱言：「原王命。」
translation: The lady then called out to the king and went out of the hall door, saying, By the king's order.

source_sentence: 展轉遍城內，至獄數千萬人，皆悉歡喜稱善稱善，皆奔走獄所：「王已得脫。
translation: They gradually pervaded the city and thousands of people were imprisoned, all rejoicing in praise of what was good and running toward the prisoners, saying, “The king has already been liberated.

source_sentence: 王已得脫。」
translation: The king has been liberated.

source_sentence: 王聞是語已：「我子兇惡，無孝順心。
translation: After hearing these words, the king said, My son is fierce and wicked, lacking in filial piety.

source_sentence: 知當更加何事，固不原我。」
translation: Know what else you should add, and you won't give it to me.

source_sentence: 即從床上自投于地，王即命終。
translation: He then rose from his bed and threw himself to the ground, and the king died.

source_sentence: 時王阿闍世弒父得無救罪。
translation: The king Ajātaśatru then kicked his father and obtained the sin of no salvation.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「前遣阿難於市唱說調達身口意所作者，正以今日事故。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Earlier, he sent Ānanda to the marketplace to explain what he had done with his body, speech, and mind in response to today's events.

source_sentence: 殺父者不得為道被法服、不得作比丘、不得作比丘尼、不得作優婆塞、不得作優婆夷、不得聽入八關齋。
translation: If someone kills their father, they mustn't wear the Dharma robe for the sake of the path, become a monk, become a bhikṣuṇī, become an upāsaka, become a Upāsikā, or enter the eight precepts.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此人無有道迹、得果證。
translation: This person has no traces of the path and attained realization of its fruit.

source_sentence: 不但殺父，殺母亦爾。
translation: Not only does killing kill one's father, but killing one's mother is likewise.

source_sentence: 若比丘知而容使為道者，與上壞僧同。」
translation: If a monk knows it and allows it to be the path, he's the same as the above-mentioned broken saṃgha.

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊王舍城耆闍崛山，與摩訶比丘五百俱。
translation: Bhagavān Buddha traveled to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa in the city of Rājagṛha accompanied by five hundred bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 爾時調達欲壞亂比丘僧，時舍利弗、目連等欲往曉喻：「調達！
translation: It was then that Tathāgata wanted to disrupt the monks and nuns, and when Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana wanted to go there at dawn, he said, Tathāgata!

source_sentence: 勿壞亂比丘僧。
translation: Don't disturb the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 僧和合一水乳一稟受。」
translation: The saṃgha and the saṃgha are united in one, and water and milk are collected in one.

source_sentence: 爾時調達弟子騫陀陀婆、迦留羅、提施、三門陀羅系頭，語舍利弗等：「諸君莫語調達作是語。
translation: It was then that the Tathāgata's disciples Candradeva, Kālôdayin, Tiṣya, and the three-pronged dhāraṇī head said to Śāriputra, Don't say such words to the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 調達如法去趣真，調達所說我等盡奉行。」
translation: Tathāgata follows the teaching and goes to the true path, and we'll fully practice what Tathāgata teaches.

source_sentence: 舍利弗等語騫陀陀婆等：「莫作是語，言調達如法毘尼。
translation: Śāriputra and others said to Candrabha and others, Don't say such words, saying that they are disciplined according to the rules of the Dharma and the vinaya.

source_sentence: 諸君莫隨調達教，鬪亂比丘僧，莫助欲鬪亂者。
translation: Don't follow the Tathāgata's teaching and disturb the monks and nuns, and don't help those who want to fight.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 僧和合一水乳一稟受，是故莫鬪亂僧、莫相佐助。」
translation: The saṃgha and the saṃgha are united into one, and water and milk are collected together as one; therefore, don't disturb the saṃgha or assist each other.

source_sentence: 此比丘語彼比丘，彼比丘不從語，故往隨調達教。
translation: This monk speaks to that monk, and that monk doesn't obey his words; therefore, he goes there to follow the Tathāgata's teaching.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗等不知當如何，往白世尊。
translation: Śāriputra and others didn't know what to do, so they went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 世尊因此事，集和合僧，備十功德，世尊為沙門結戒：「若比丘有壞亂僧者，於中相佐助，僧伽婆尸沙。」
translation: For this reason, the Bhagavān gathered together the ten attributes of the saṃgha and prepared the ten virtues, and the Bhagavān formed the precepts for the ascetic, If a monk has disrupted the saṃgha, they'll assist each other in it, Saṃghâvaśeṣa.

source_sentence: 佛世尊遊王舍城耆闍崛山，與五百大比丘俱。
translation: Bhagavān Buddha traveled to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa in the city of Rājagṛha accompanied by five hundred great bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊著衣持鉢從耆闍崛山來入王舍城分衛，分衛已還詣耆闍崛山，於石室結跏趺坐，七日不起入種種正受。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, wearing his robes and carrying his bowl, came from Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and entered Rājagṛha to guard the city of Rājagṛha, returned to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa after guarding it, sat cross-legged in a stone chamber, and entered various meditations for seven days without rising or entering.

source_sentence: 過七日已，著衣持鉢從耆闍崛山入王舍城分衛。
translation: After seven days had passed, he put on his robes and took his bowl from Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa into Rājagṛha to guard the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時調達聞沙門瞿曇遊王舍城耆闍崛山，將從弟子五百人，至時著衣持鉢從耆闍崛山入王舍城分衛，分衛已還入石室一跏趺坐，七日乃起。
translation: When he heard that the ascetic Gautama was traveling to Rājagṛha on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa in Rājagṛha with five hundred of his disciples, he put on his robes and took his bowl and entered the city of Rājagṛha to guard it. After guarding it, he returned to sit cross-legged in a stone chamber for seven days before rising.

source_sentence: 阿闍世王有象，名望伽婆(暮藏反)，兇惡暴橫，邊國諸王無此惡象，如阿闍世王望伽婆。
translation: King Ajātaśatru had an elephant named Kauṣṭhila (known as mokṣa), which was fierce and violent, and the kings of the borderlands didn't have such a bad elephant, just like King Ajātaśatru looking at Kauṣṭhila.

source_sentence: 時調達懷五百兩金，詣望伽婆象師所，語象師言：「汝知我阿闍世王許有力勢不？」
translation: With five hundred taels of gold in his hand, Tathāgata then went to the elephant trainer Gava and said to the elephant trainer, Do you know whether my Ajātaśatru will allow me to have strong momentum?

source_sentence: 對曰：「知。」
translation: He replied, Yes.

source_sentence: 「若我使人富貴能不？」
translation: Suppose I envoy someone is wealthy and capable?

source_sentence: 答曰：「有是力。」
translation: He answered, There's such power.

source_sentence: 時調達將五百兩金：「以此雇卿，辦我此事。
translation: The governor then gave me five hundred taels of gold, saying, hired you to do this for me.

source_sentence: 亦當語王，與汝田業。」
translation: You should also tell the king to give it to your crops and fields.

source_sentence: 「不審何事？」
translation: What is the matter that you don't examine?

source_sentence: 調達語：「此沙門瞿曇遊王舍城耆闍崛山，將從弟子五百人，到時著衣持鉢來至王舍城分衛。
translation: Tathāgata said, This ascetic Gautama traveled to Rājagṛha in the city of Rājagṛha on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa with five hundred disciples who arrived at the time wearing robes and bowls and came to the garrison of Rājagṛha to guard it.

source_sentence: 分衛已還耆闍崛山，結跏趺坐七日不起。
translation: After partially guarding it, he returned to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa and sat cross-legged for seven days without rising.

source_sentence: 若入羅閱祇城時，汝將此望伽婆象與醇清酒使飲，解鋼鐵絆，放使殺沙門瞿曇。」
translation: If you enter the city of Rājagṛha, take this kṣatriya elephant and give it to the ascetic Gautama to drink alcohol, untie the bond of steel and iron, and let him kill the ascetic Gautama.

source_sentence: 象師答言：「此是小事不足殷勤。
translation: The elephant master replied, This is a minor matter that isn't enough to be done with diligence.

source_sentence: 若我事辦後，願不見忽。」
translation: If my business is done later, I hope you won't forget it.

source_sentence: 時象師日日屈指數待七日。
translation: Each day, the elephant master bends and waits for seven days.

source_sentence: 七日已至，以醇清酒飲望伽婆象，以鋼鐵絆絆使不動，隱城門間以待如來。
translation: When the seventh day had arrived, he gave a drink of alcohol and wine to the elephant in charge of the Ganges. He fastened it with an iron chain so that it would not budge but remained hidden at the gates of the city to wait for the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 諸佛常法若欲入城有諸瑞應，象鳴舉鼻馬鳴牛吼，鳧雁鴛鴦孔雀鸚鵡白鵠千秋鶴盡皆和鳴，箜篌箏鼓琵琶筑笛不鼓自鳴，諸長者庫藏金銀水精瑠璃珊瑚虎珀車渠馬瑙不觸自作聲。

source_sentence: 盲者得眼、聾者得聽、瞎跛躄癭諸苦痛者皆得休息，伏藏自發。
translation: The blind get their eyes, the deaf get their ears, and the blind and crippled attain hearing. All those who suffer from blindness and lame will be able to rest and conceal it for themselves.

source_sentence: 世尊入城有此瑞應。
translation: The Bhagavān entered the city, and there was this miraculous response.

source_sentence: 時御象師知佛欲至城門，便解象鋼鐵絆放，數千萬人各各奔走求所安處，人民怖懼，或入舍內、或復上屋閣上立。
translation: Knowing that the Buddha was about to approach the city gates, the royal elephant master released the elephant's steel fetters and released it.

source_sentence: 象奔如來所，人民愕看，各各唱言。
translation: The elephants rushed to the place where the Buddha was staying, but the people were startled and cried out in wonder.

source_sentence: 其中不信佛者：「咄咄殺是沙門。」
translation: Those among them who don't believe in the Buddha say, Duh-duh killed this as a monk.

source_sentence: 其信佛者：「此小象無如佛何。」
translation: Those who believed in the Buddha said, This small elephant is nothing like the Buddha.

source_sentence: 有一長者遙見象走，便乘一象先至佛所，頭面禮足在一面立，白世尊言：「此望伽婆象以清酒飲使令醉，解鋼絆却使來害世尊。
translation: An elderly man saw the elephant running from a distance, so he rode an elephant to where the Buddha was. Having saluted him by bowing his forehead at his feet, he stood to one side and said to the World-honored One: I wish that the royal elephant Gavāṃpati will give me some wine to make me feel thirsty.

source_sentence: 善哉世尊！
translation: Excellent, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 願入此舍避、若還出城。
translation: May I enter this house to avoid it and leave it if I return out of the city?

source_sentence: 此象狂醉，備害如來。」
translation: This elephant is so crazy and drunk that it prepares to harm the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「此象終不害我。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, This elephant will never harm me.

source_sentence: 世尊終不為他所殺。」
translation: The Bhagavān will never be killed by someone else.

source_sentence: 象遙見如來及比丘僧，蹋地瞋吼噤切牙齒、張郭兩耳擎鼻揵尾，急走向世尊所。
translation: From a distance, the elephant saw the Tathāgata and the monks and bhikṣus stepping on the ground with angry roar and cutting their teeth, raising their noses and tails in both ears, and quickly walking toward the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘僧見象走趣，毛衣皆竪，棄遠如來，唯有阿難一人不去。
translation: When the monks and nuns saw the elephant running away, their hair and clothes stood on end and they abandoned the Tathāgata from a distance, but Ānanda alone didn't go.

source_sentence: 時象至如來前，世尊仁慈意向象，醉勢解無瞋怒心，兩膝跪地以舌舐如來足。
translation: When the elephant came before the Tathāgata, the Bhagavān was kind and compassionate to the elephant, released his drunkenness without anger or anger, knelt with both kneels on the ground, licked the Tathāgata's feet with his tongue, and lick them.

source_sentence: 「汝莫起嗔恚，　　害心向如來，
translation: Don’t become angry, harming the Tathāgata with malicious intent.

source_sentence: 其嗔恚向佛，　　終不生善處。
translation: Their anger is directed toward the Buddha, and they're never born in a good place.

source_sentence: 伊羅鉢那象，　　在於二天宮，
translation: The elephant Elāpattra Is in the palace of the two heavens.

source_sentence: 如須彌山側，　　諸象王處中，
translation: It's like the side of Mount Sumeru, where there are elephant kings.

source_sentence: 彼靈山之頂，　　阿耨達象王，
translation: At the top of that spiritual mountain, Anavatapta is the king of elephants.

source_sentence: 皆稽首正覺，　　汝種害佛殃。
translation: They all bowed their heads to the right awakening, saying, You're harming the Buddha's misfortune.

source_sentence: 諸象修善本，　　而得在彼處，
translation: The elephants cultivate the roots of goodness And are able to stay there.

source_sentence: 汝今醉懷害，　　安得生彼數？」
translation: Now that you're drunk and harboring harm, how can you be born there?

source_sentence: 時世尊出金色臂摩象頭，如父告子而說偈言：時望伽婆象悲泣墮淚，頭面禮足便去，七日不食草命過，即生第四天上。
translation: The Bhagavān then emerged with a golden-colored arm and touched the elephant's head, just as his father told his son, and he spoke these verses in verse, saying, When he looked out for the fourth heaven, the Kṣābhâva elephant wept and bowed his head and feet, and departed without eating grass for seven days, it was born in the fourth heaven.

source_sentence: 時數千萬人見如來此變化，盡來至佛所。
translation: Tens of thousands of people then saw the Tathāgata's transformation, and they all came to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊顧語阿難：「汝往取床及水，我欲洗足。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān looked around and said to Ānanda, Go get your bed and water; I want to wash my feet.

source_sentence: 時阿難承佛教，即布床備水。
translation: Ānanda then inherited the Buddha's teaching, which was to prepare a bed and water for him.

source_sentence: 阿難右膝著地，白世尊言：「床水已辦，願如來往洗脚。」
translation: Ānanda knelt with his right knee on the ground and said to the Bhagavān, The water for the bed is ready, so may the Tathāgata go and wash his feet.

source_sentence: 洗脚已，爾時世尊坐三昧，現種種變化，東沒西涌、北沒南涌，坐臥虛空，身放光明，青黃白黑或瑠璃色，身下出火身上出水、身上出火身下出水。
translation: After washing his feet, the Bhagavān then sat in samādhi and showed various transformations, descending from the east to the west and rising from the north to the south, sitting or lying in midair, his body emitting light that was blue, yellow, white, black, or lapis lazuli-colored, water coming out of under his body, water coming out of under his body, and water coming out

source_sentence: 作種種變化已還復本坐，結跏趺坐。
translation: After performing various transformations, he returned to his original seat and sat cross-legged.

source_sentence: 爾時人民見世尊變化，心開意解。
translation: At the time, when the people saw the Bhagavān's transformation, their minds were enlightened.

source_sentence: 時世尊觀眾生意，種種說法，各得所願。
translation: The Bhagavān then attended the business and explained the various teachings, each obtaining what he wished.

source_sentence: 其中人民或發神足意者，或發信根，或發法忍，或得道迹果、頻來果、不還果，發無上正真道意、辟支佛聲聞意，拘利人得度。
translation: The people there may give rise to the intention to practice supernormal abilities, or they may give rise to the faculty of faith, or they may give rise to the forbearance of the Dharma, or they may attain the fruit of the path, the fruit of frequently coming, or the fruit of nonreturning, or they may give rise to the intention to pursue the unsurpassed true path and the intention of the prat

source_sentence: 爾時世尊不及中食，右肱挾阿難飛還耆闍崛山。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān didn't finish his midday meal, and he flew back to Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa with his right shoulder holding Ānanda in his arms.

source_sentence: 時五百比丘迸走諸谷，羌虜中乞食。
translation: Five hundred monks then fled into the valleys and begged for food in the Qiang prisoners.

source_sentence: 乞食已各還精舍，舉衣已詣世尊所，頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: After begging for food, they each returned to the monastery, lifted their robes, went to the Bhagavān, bowed their heads and feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 眾多比丘白世尊言：「甚奇甚特。
translation: The many monks said to the Bhagavān, That's very rare and extraordinary.

source_sentence: 是阿難見大象來，不捨世尊左右。」
translation: When Ānanda saw the great elephant coming, he didn't leave the Bhagavān's left and right.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「不但今日。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, Not only today.

source_sentence: 聽我說。
translation: Listen to me as I explain.

source_sentence: 昔久遠世時有鹿王，名失利末，與五百鹿在雪山止。
translation: Formerly, long ago, there was a deer king named Shilimati who lived in the Himalayas together with five hundred deer.

source_sentence: 時有獵師散飯草間，張大繩弶。
translation: A hunter then scattered a large rope between the rice and grass and spread it out among them.

source_sentence: 鹿王在前，左足墮弶。
translation: The deer king was in front of him, with his left foot falling into the air.

source_sentence: 鹿王便作是念：『若我告諸鹿墮弶者，諸鹿不得食想。』
translation: The deer king then thought, 'If I tell the deer to fall into a pit, the deer won't be allowed to eat it.'

source_sentence: 諸鹿食足，便告言：『我今墮弶。』
translation: The deer ate their food and then told them, 'Now, I'll fall into a pit.'

source_sentence: 諸鹿聞是語皆各迸走，唯有一鹿不捨失利末王走。
translation: When each of the deer heard these words, they all fled, but only one deer didn't let go of it and lost Rima-rāja.

source_sentence: 時此鹿白鹿王言：『努力求脫，今獵師至。』
translation: The deer then said to the king of deer, 'Exerting themselves to seek liberation, the hunter has arrived.'

source_sentence: 答：『我今竭力求脫，繩麁入網，知當奈何？』
translation: Answer: 'Now that I've exhausted myself to seek liberation and entered the net with a rope, what do you know about it?'

source_sentence: 獵師至前，此一鹿言：『寧執刀前殺我身却，乃殺王。』
translation: When the hunter came before him, this deer said, 'I'd rather kill myself in front of you with a sword than kill the king.'

source_sentence: 獵師作是念：『怪其能語，此畜奇，復欲代他死。』
translation: The hunter thought, 'I wonder what he's able to say, for this animal is so rare that it might want to die on behalf of others.'

source_sentence: 便語鹿，言：『我不殺汝亦不殺汝王。
translation: They then said to the deer, 'I won't kill you, and I won't kill your king.

source_sentence: 我今解弶放汝王去。』
translation: Now, I'll free you king and let him go.'

source_sentence: 便解弶放之。」
translation: He'll then be released and released.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「爾時鹿王者，即我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, At the time, that deer king was me.

source_sentence: 爾時五百鹿者，今五百比丘是。
translation: The five hundred deer of that time are now the five hundred bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 爾時亦棄我，今復棄我。
translation: At the time, you also abandoned me, and now you abandon me again.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師者，今望伽婆象是。
translation: At the time, the hunter was the present-day Changqiapo elephant.

source_sentence: 本不觸我，今復不觸。
translation: They didn't touch me in the past and won't touch me again in the future.

source_sentence: 爾時一鹿者，今阿難是。
translation: At the time, that deer was now Ānanda.

source_sentence: 本不捨我，今亦不捨我。」
translation: They didn't abandon me in the past, and they won't abandon me now.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊因此事，重說往昔所更。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān repeatedly explained what he had changed in the past for this reason.

source_sentence: 「去波羅奈斯不遠，有池水名吉雨，水涌出豐多魚鱉，多雁鴛鴦。
translation: Not far from Vārāṇasī is a pond of water called Jixing, with plenty of fish and turtles in abundance and plenty of geese and mandarin ducks.

source_sentence: 彼有雁王，名蹄提賴晝，將從五百雁於池水戲。
translation: There was a king of geese there, named Jyotirādhara, who was playing in the pond with five hundred geese.

source_sentence: 爾時獵師張羅捕雁。
translation: It was then that the hunter Zhang Luo caught a goose.

source_sentence: 時雁王墮羅網中，便作是念：『若我說墮羅網者，諸雁驚不得食。』
translation: The king of geese then fell into the net, and he thought, 'If I say I fall into the net, the geese won't be able to eat it.'

source_sentence: 諸雁食足，便言：『我墮羅網。』
translation: The geese eat their feet, and they say, 'I'll fall into the net of hell.'

source_sentence: 諸雁聞驚，各各飛散。
translation: The geese were frightened and each flew away.

source_sentence: 有一雁名須默，獨住不去。
translation: There was a geese named Sumeru, which lived alone and didn't go.

source_sentence: 時雁王語須默：『我今墮羅網，汝代我作王。』
translation: The king of the geese then said to Sumeru, 'Now that I've fallen into the net of Rāṣṭrapāla, you'll become king for me.'

source_sentence: 須默答：『我不堪任代王處。』
translation: They must reply in silence, 'I can't go to the king's place.'

source_sentence: 王問：『何故不堪？』
translation: The king asked, 'Why isn't it?'

source_sentence: 「『寧與王俱死，　　不失王獨活；
translation: 'It's better to die together with the king, without losing the king's life alone.

source_sentence: 生死牽連久，　　不敢獨解脫。』
translation: For a long time, birth and death have been dragged along, so I won't dare to be liberated alone.'

source_sentence: 須默以偈答曰：「時雁王方便求脫，不能得解。
translation: Shunmu replied in verse, At the time, the king of geese was skillfully seeking liberation but couldn't get it.

source_sentence: 「『雁王血肉，　　與我無異。　　汝先殺我，
translation: The flesh and blood of the king of the geese Is no different from mine.

source_sentence: 願赦王罝。』
translation: May I forgive the king's ill-will.'
